intro: Grindelia squarrosa var. grandiflora, commonly known as the desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green, fuzzy foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its flowers are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects. The species is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
